bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order & Judgment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and Sisiter Superior M. Angelique, for a Writ of certiorari} No. 1078
In the Matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Georgette Normand and marie Le Fevre for a Writ of habeas corpus.

This matter coming on for hearing upon the supplemental retun of James P. Levin, Immigrant Inspector, and Sister Superior M. Angelique, Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, appearing for attorneys, and H.C. Gill apearing for the appearing for the applicants for a writ of habeas corpus, and the Court having considered the original retun to the writ of habeas corpus and the suplemental retun and petition for modification of the judgment heretofore made herein, and having listening to argument of counsel, and being fully advised, concludes as a matter of law upon the facts disclosed by the original and supplemental retuns, that said applicants for a writ of habeas corpus having been only temporarily removed from the steamship "Rosalie" for the purposes of examination by the Treasury officials, and not having been landed in the United States, that the inly action warranted under the law is the refusal to them of the right to land in theis country, and the only country to which they can lawfuly be retunedupon such refusal to land is the country from which they had come immediatly prior to such rejection, to-writ, to British Columbia. The Court further finds as a matter of law that they not having landed in this county and not having been found herein, are not subject to deportation by warrant of the Secretary of the tresury to the country to which they belong and from whence they originally came, to-wit, France;

It is Therefore ordered that said petition for re-hearing and modification
of Judgment be, and the same is denied, and the petitioner, James P. Lavin, immigrant inspector, is directed to cary into effect the original order on the 13th day of February, 1903, by this Court, with regards to his custody. Done in open court this 5th day of March, 1903
In the matter of the application of James P. Lavin and of Curtiurari
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON MAR 5 1903 A.REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd Dep.
